intro: Thlaspidea arvensis, commonly known as the field thlaspi, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is a small annual herb that typically grows in disturbed soils and agricultural fields. The plant has simple, alternate leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its fruit is a short pod that contains several seeds. Thlaspidea arvensis is often considered a weed but plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for small invertebrates.
